pros: High paced environment where problem solving and human interaction is crucial to drive sales for our mission of home building
cons: They hire who they want for management roles and not the actual qualified assistant managers they have.

review_title: Great People, Great Place to Work
job_title: Delivery Driver in Jefferson City, TN
pros: Excellent administration. Good hours. A great work environment.
cons: The wage could be better.

pros: -Positive and pleasant work environment -Kind staff -Simple work
cons: -Job required a great deal of physical labour -Often under staffed

job_title: Social Media Contributor in Greenville, NC
pros: -provided valuable experience -worked with very understanding people
cons: -environment was constantly changing during the time I was there

pros: Kind compassionate employees who want to serve those and others. Friendly, knowledgeable. By far the best job I have ever worked. I love working here and look forward to coming in each morning and never dread a Monday.
cons: The pay isn't the best, but I will trade compensation for my sanity any day.

job_title: Retail Store Associate in Venice, FL
pros: I thoroughly enjoyed getting to work at my local Habitat for Humanity ReStore. Management was very trusting of us and I was able to work at my own pace and contribute my own ideas. The people I worked with made the job a lot more personable and enjoyable and the pay for the work was very adequate.
cons: Some cons that I would say is that sometimes there would be some co-worker conflicts that would hinder co-worker relationships and business operations. Disagreements and conflict were not managed as effectively sometimes.

pros: Lot of fun events. Fun environment and great way to learn new things.
cons: Low pay and very heavy work. Also understaffed.

pros: • You get to help people, that's about the only good aspect.
cons: • Absolutely horrible management. Arrogant, lying, malicious, manipulative, petty and backbiting. • Terrible pay for the amount of labor and customer service required.

pros: Work culture among my colleagues was fantastic. The job was a little different every day which was always exciting. No matter what, everyone was always willing to pitch in to meet whatever need was imminent. Within a year of being there I had the opportunity to move into a management position and help with organizing logistics as well as continuing to work throughout the warehouse each day. Additionally, meeting and working alongside a wide range of volunteers was a lot of fun.
cons: One of the most tenured and hardworking people there got severely injured on the job and the organization did a poor job of caring for them. Seeing them neglect my colleague tainted my entire experience there. I could no longer stay there and risk my body for a negligible wage

pros: Good entry level pay for anyone.
cons: Lots of manual labor. Lots of movement.

pros: Helping raise money for a good cause. The time flies by because there is always much to do.
cons: High expectations for getting things done with minimal staff. Dealing with rude customers.

review_title: Run Thrift store to help build homes
pros: Fun people and great items
cons: Floor is concrete... comfortable shoes are a must

job_title: Truck Drive & Sales Associate in Durango, CO
pros: Meeting and working with the families going into the homes being built gives you an amazing feeling! You get a great workout and can look foward to something new everyday.
cons: Although you're given a specific title management makes it known every employee has to learn all jobs and be able to perform all duties and some but only get paid for one. Although given specific rules and guidelines to follow, management will override to accommodate board members or friends. Due to new set store hours store staff are unable to be full-time therefore no benefits, no requesting PTO, and barely accommodate sick days (you'll be lucky if they don't make you feel bad). Management will push for you to make all appointments on your days off. Coming from an unprivileged situation I couldn't "text" my doctor as they requested to ask for medical advice. They want you to finish all their tasks given on top of running the store but dissaprove of coming in too early and staying late. Management says they want you to take responsibility to run the store but will come down and start to take over, then come "talk" to you but only to say what they don't like about what you're doing. They say customer service is important but from my experience management liked to come down to the store at the busiest times to either watch you and not help or pull you away from a customer to "remind" you of a task they want you to do right then and there. The only cultural inclusion management knows is around Mexican culture. Once they have your phone number management will call/text outside of business hours and inform you late when deciding not to open the store. Management will brag about the past employees that were football players. They will refer to any male as "muscles" and thank them for lifting a leaf. Coming from a females perspective I've had no problems lifting anything in the store unless recovering from being sick but I got tired of management praising any male and no recognition for my efforts or entrusting me with any power tools, regardless of my previous carpentry experience and knowledge. I've put in many reports involving safety and recommendations but no changes were made or even talked about. Management will say they have lifting restrictions but will do so anyway and make you feel bad for them making the decision to lift in the first place. Doesn't matter how hard you work, you will be micromanaged everyday. You have to have thick skin to be able to put up with management and getting talked at by at least one customer a day.

pros: Good benefits, RRSP by company contribution to match employee 3%, always something to do workwise. Staff work well together. There are no real deadlines on work.
cons: They don't know what their niche is in the Retail business. Too many bosses and directions. Managers arent really mangers in that they dont have a true say in what they can do with their store. Direction is all over the board.

pros: It is a fun and unique work environment. Sometimes the informality of the location I worked at made things more fun while still providing good service
cons: There is no structure, it’s unprofessional, and there is no protocol to prevent crossing of boundaries of employees

review_title: Outstanding peoplePerson Exceed beyond the average adult with my work ethics
pros: Getting the opportunity to Volunteer and also be employed on other the days I was off ,and I think it's my absolute favorite job I've ever been employed.
cons: Down side of it was it being so cold in the receiving area but regardless never a dull moment so in reality there's no down side .

pros: people/ hours / involved in the community/ honest
cons: Pay/ part time employees/ people dumping trash all hours of the day out side your store

job_title: Floor Sales Associate in Fairfield, CA
pros: Contributing to the building of homes for low income families and making the dream of home ownership possible. First dibs on purchasing donations
cons: Few full time positions available.

review_title: Mostly a Great Place to Work
pros: family oriented, understanding of unexpected life occurrences, flexible with job flow, fair pay scale
cons: lack of communication in chain of command sometimes

pros: Positive work environment, flexible and supportive management, benefits for full time employees
cons: Disorganized process for intake. High turnover. Long hours with many different responsibilities not worth the money.

review_title: Love this place because the people there are amazing!
pros: The environment is great.  You get to meet a lot of wonderful people in the community.  Tons to do so never a dull moment there is always something to do.  Your input is heard and valued.  This is a place that welcomes and truly wants to help people and make a difference.
cons: I can’t think of any.

pros: Friendly co-workers for the most part.
cons: The application and interview process makes the job seem like it will be a management position. Unfortunately, less than a week in, it becomes apparent that the job advertisement must have been written that way in order to reel in potential employees with a good work ethic, dedication, and open schedule. The store manager is the root of the issue. Right off the bat, he made sexist comments about the all women management team he had hired together to collectively be "Assistant managers". He was extremely rude and occasionally racist to volunteers who either offered their time or had community hours to make up at the store. The micro-management by the store manager made it extremely difficult to learn how to carry out daily tasks to the specifications only he knew that often contradicted how he had previously taught the tasks. This created an atmosphere every day of frustration, belittlement, and low morale. The day is really set by how management interacts with the staff and there wasn't a day that I didn't go home feeling frustrated and insulted.

pros: Friendly staff/co-workers and change duties every few hours
cons: Working the receiving dock for donations and explaining why you can't accept their donation

review_title: Good place to work for resume building
pros:
-Fulfilling job if you enjoy non-profit/have a desire to help the community.
-Great staff
-Off everyday around 6pm as well a Sundays off.
cons:
-Job can get very confusing due to lack of direction or set schedule especially for new workers.
-Pay is not great for the amount of work being accomplished.

pros: Extremely flexible and accommodating, great higher ups, and ultimately a extremely pleasant place to work.
cons: Due to relying on donations which can be random there can be some lack of organization

pros: Always busy, great staff, hard-working volunteers

pros: Great hours. Great customers. Incredible store manager

review_title: Disappointed me and honestly broke my heart.

pros: Relaxed, lots of great employees.
cons: They have a lot of employee rotation, turn over rates. They'll fire for pretty much anything. I was fired because I wasn't "in contact with" them every single day during my recovery from COVID. The manager said "are you honestly surprised?" when he fired me. Like I should have expected to get fired.

review_title: Great environment, but pay could be a little better
pros: Everyone I worked with, and most volunteers, were very passionate and engaged. Every day was new and exciting. Most customers were appreciative and kind. The benefits were pretty good for the type of job.
cons: The pay was good for a part-time, entry-level job, but there was no salary increase to be full-time. Some customers were difficult to work with.

pros: Love love love the cause for the non-profit organization, volunteers are super kind and easy to get along with, managers are very understanding and handles any sorts of trouble.
cons: Literally the worst customers I've ever had to deal with my entire life. Completely rude, not understanding, yells at staff for pricing when the proceeds go for a good cause. They dump their 'donations' (broken furniture, light fixtures that dont work, just straight up garbage) in front of the store for us to clean up.

pros: Helping people access more accessible furniture

pros: Working with mostly wonderful people, both employees and volunteers.  Learning SO MUCH over the course of my time there during the processing from much more experienced handymen and women and whomever else that that had so much information to offer.  Pay isn’t bad.
cons: Upper management and HR didn’t take complaints made from ReStore staff seriously.

job_title: Retail Sales Associate in Junction City, OR
pros: Freedom to help customers make decisions on purchasing second hand items.
cons: The pay could be more but it’s non-profit so…

pros:
If there's stuff that no one else has bought you can sometimes get it for free
The other employees are really nice 99% of the time
Some of my coworkers said that the "mentally disturbed" people who would frequently come in on weekends were scary and alarming, personally I only had one case that was even remotely alarming because they weren't wearing shoes in December, the rest were actually way nicer and more polite than the so-called "normal people" at the restore.
cons:
Administration sucks. They never showed up and made terrible adjustments to how we worked that made it harder to do so. Nobody likes them. 
Some customers can be rude or entitled, but that's typical for customer service.

pros: Great management, really good employees and it’s all supporting a good cause.
cons: Heavy lifting, constant store organizing, large furniture moving, heavy/bulky item pickup, low pay

review_title: Rewarding way to support local families
pros: Super rewarding! Meeting new homeowners is honestly one of the most exciting parts. Knowing that the company is working towards supporting local families and getting them into a home when that option would not be available to them any other way, is amazing to be a part of.
cons:
Lots of heavy lifting even for the cashiers.
The pay isn't great, but the benefits are worth it.

cons: Back areas and often the sales floor are so cluttered it's a hazard

review_title: Amazing organization! It's all about the affiliate & the Board of Directors you work for...
pros: Amazing organization with a phenomenal mission. HFHI is outstanding with tons of training opportunities and an ever-growing amount of support and resources.
cons: It's all about the Board of Directors you work for. It seems larger affiliates have better opportunities for growth. Smaller communities are often restricted by a smaller pool of qualified Board Member candidates, major donors and other resources necessary to promote solid growth amongst the organization.

review_title: Best job I've ever had. Pay was above par, but I got my undergrad degree and moved on.
job_title: Sales Floor Team Member in Danbury, CT
pros:
Flexibility - I worked here as I went to college, so they were very understanding of my inconsistent availability and worked with my changing schedule.
Pay - compensation was above what similar jobs offer, but the job was less demanding, physically and mentally.
People - Best team I've ever had the pleasure to work with. Of course there are bad apples, but my store had a great team.
cons:
I'm a fairly young, relatively healthy guy, so the the physical workload was a piece of cake for me. Lifting a heavy door or window could be tough for some people, though.
Since this is a non-profit, our revenues didn't translate into bonuses or raises (if that were the case, there would be something very wrong with the non-profit structure). If you're looking for financial gain and advancement, this is not the right sector to be in.

review_title: Loved this job until management ruined it.

cons: Management that does not care who you are. No PTO for general workers.
